intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. cuneatulum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and prefers full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
